description: The producer and songwriter for Beyoncé and Rihanna was sued in federal court Tuesday by a former protogée.
title: The-Dream, R&B star and Beyoncé songwriter, accused of rape

description: Ippei Mizuhara, who worked alongside Ohtani for years, pleaded guilty to two counts related to the theft of nearly $17 million from the baseball star. He could face up to 33 years in prison.
title: Shohei Ohtani's ex-interpreter pleads guilty to charges related to gambling and theft

description: Loosely based on a true story, Richard Linklater's film about a professor working with the police features strong performances, shrewd writing and a light and funny tone.
title: A mild-mannered professor assumes the persona of a 'Hit Man' in this twisted tale

description: 13 states introduced bills this year that could give rights to embryos and fetuses associated with people. None passed yet but IVF patients and doctors fear such laws could limit fertility treatment.
title: The push for embryo rights in state legislatures worries IVF patients and doctors

description: An innovative program in Tampa aims to stop community violence by focusing on teens arrested for carrying guns. It offers support and mentors so they can get a new start outside of the jail system.
title: In Florida, teens caught with guns get a second chance to turn their lives around

description: NPR's A Martínez visits Georgia to see the problems some Americans have accessing healthcare and to hear from providers about what they need to fix it.
title: Rural U.S. health care is in a crisis. We went to a Georgia town to see how people there experience it

description: Democratic Congressman Andy Kim challenged the state's powerful political machine and won in court and on the ground, making him the unlikely favorite in this November's Senate race.
title: Andy Kim upended New Jersey politics. Now he’s on track to become a senator.

description: Our critics scanned the broadcast and streaming horizons to find the shows you should check out in June, July and August. There's some great new TV — plus, House of the Dragon and The Bear are back.
title: What to watch this summer: Here are the TV shows we're looking forward to

description: Archivists at the University of Houston have saved decades-worth of episodes of local LGBT radio shows that started in the 1970s. Together they tell the story of a complex, diverse community.
title: Saving Houston’s LGBTQ history through thousands of hours of radio archives

description: Chants calling for “intifada” have been a prominent feature of pro-Palestinian student protests. It’s a charged word whose use is perceived differently by people with opposing views of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
title: Chants of 'intifada' ring out from pro-Palestinian protests. But what's it mean?

description: India “missed the bus” on manufacturing. A new book argues that India can nonetheless grow rich by leapfrogging to an economy dominated by high-skills services.
title: India lost the manufacturing race to China. Here's why it could still succeed

description: Costco's new leadership says the $1.50 price tag on its beloved hot dog combo is "safe." Experts explain how the retailer has defied inflation — and why it's willing to eat the cost.
title: Costco hot dogs have cost $1.50 since the 1980s. Here's why prices aren't changing

description: Rural health care in the U.S. is facing a crisis. We visited a town in Georgia to see how some people are getting health care and to hear from providers about what they need to fix it.
title: Rural U.S. health care is in a crisis. We went to a Georgia town to see how people there experience it

description: The once small newspaper was founded by Chinese dissidents. It became prominent in right-wing media in recent years but is now facing accusations that a top officer laundered at least $67 million.
title: The DOJ has indicted an Epoch Times executive for money laundering
